concept.title: Reference Topics
concept.shortdesc: Reference topics provide structured, factual information that complements and supports both task and concept topics.

section.p: Reference content should be concise, easy to scan, and non-narrative. Examples include configuration tables, field definitions, API specifications, and system requirements. Reference topics consolidate information that users need to look up for quick reference.

section.title: User Intent
section.p: "I need to find specific information quickly."

ul.li: Prioritize ease of lookup over narrative flow.
Use consistent formatting for similar information types.
Organize information logically (for example, by importance, by workflow, or alphabetically).
Provide cross-references to related concepts and tasks.
